breadthTimer.title: Breath Assessment
breadthTimer.subtitle: Measure your breath-holding capacity to assess respiratory function. A simple yet effective way to monitor your lung health.
breadthTimer.description: Measures how long you can comfortably hold your breath after a normal inhale. Reduced capacity could be an early sign of respiratory issues.
breadthTimer.step1: Sit comfortably and take a few normal breaths to relax
breadthTimer.step2: Click "Start" and take a normal breath in (not too deep)
breadthTimer.step3: Hold your breath as long as comfortable (don't strain)
breadthTimer.step4: Click "Stop" when you need to exhale

assessments.severeDesc: Your breath-holding time is significantly reduced, which could indicate respiratory issues. This may be related to existing respiratory conditions or environmental factors. Please complete the assessment survey for a more detailed analysis.
assessments.moderateDesc: Your breath-holding capacity is below average. While this isn't necessarily alarming, it could indicate minor respiratory issues. Regular monitoring is recommended.
assessments.normalDesc: Your breath-holding time is within the normal range. This suggests good respiratory function. Continue to monitor regularly for any changes.
